intro: Psychotria phelpsiana, commonly known as Phelps' psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red when mature. This species is often found in shaded, moist environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
